title: Udaipur
short_description: Experience lakeside royalty in the Venice of the East, home to the iconic Lake Palace.
long_description:
Udaipur, often called the 'Venice of the East', is arguably India's most romantic city. Founded in 1559 by Maharana Udai Singh II, it is set around a series of artificial lakes and is known for its lavish royal residences. The City Palace, overlooking Lake Pichola, is a monumental complex of 11 palaces, courtyards and gardens, famed for its intricate peacock mosaics.

But the true magic of Udaipur lies in living its history. Here, you can stay in palaces that seem to float on water, like the world-renowned Taj Lake Palace, or reside in the royal guest house of Shiv Niwas, where Queen Elizabeth II once stayed. The city's skyline is dominated by domes and turrets, and its narrow streets are filled with the color and craft of Rajasthan. A royal stay in Udaipur is not just about luxury; it is about stepping into a painting of Rajput valour and grandeur.

properties.title: Taj Lake Palace
properties.short_description: Originally built as a pleasure palace, this white marble wonder floats in the middle of Lake Pichola.

properties.title: The Oberoi Udaivilas
properties.short_description: Located on the banks of Lake Pichola, famous for its rambling courtyards and 20-acre wildlife sanctuary.

properties.title: The Leela Palace
properties.short_description: A modern palace evoking the grandeur of the Mewar era with stunning views of the City Palace.

properties.title: Shiv Niwas Palace
properties.short_description: Part of the City Palace complex, this crescent-shaped palace was originally reserved for royal guests.

properties.title: Taj Fateh Prakash Palace
properties.short_description: Home to the dazzling Crystal Gallery, this palace offers a genuine taste of Mewar royalty.

properties.title: Chunda Palace
properties.short_description: A boutique palace showcasing hand-painted frescoes and intricate glasswork typical of the region.

properties.title: RAAS Devigarh
properties.short_description: Located in Delwara, this restored fort blends modern minimalism with ancient stone architecture.

properties.title: The LaLiT Laxmi Vilas Palace
properties.short_description: Built by Maharana Fateh Singh in 1911, this palace sits atop a hill with panoramic valley views.

how_to_reach: Udaipur has its own airport (Maharana Pratap Airport) with connections to Delhi and Mumbai. It is also well-connected by rail and road.
